page.title: 08LOCAL HISTORY IN WYTHALL
page.content: {Blackgreaves Farm }is one of the few farms in the country which has a moat around it.It was originally mentioned in the{Domesday Book 1086}It was called Blackgraves Farm because in the Middle Ages there was a Black Death and some of the people who died in Birmingham were supposed to be buried nearby.The farm house is a listed building and was built in 1827.The Farm is managed in conjunction with Mount Pleasant Farm.The two farms are rented from{ {Bournville Village Trust.}They rear their own calves.The buck calves are sold to Kidderminster Market as beef.They own 70 dairy cows and 40 heifers.The 2 farms consist of 243 acres,150 are needed for supporting the animals.The milk is sold to M.M.B. {Silvermead}
